6.1. Numeric Types¶

Integer types are signed or unsigned, indicated by a “s” or “u” prefix to the type name. Numeric types also have a suffix that indicates the number of bits allocated to the data type.

Table 6.1: Integer Types¶
Integer Type Minimum Value Maximum Value
sint8 -128 127
sint16 -32,768 32,767
sint32 -2,147,483,648 2,147,483,647
sint64 -9223372036854775808 9223372036854775807
uint8 0 255
uint16 0 65,535
uint32 0 4,294,967,295
uint64 0 18446744073709551615

Integer types can be mixed in expressions and are always converted to the largest type.

ITTIA DB IoT provides two floating-point types: float32, and float64. The float type is an alias for float64.

Table 6.2: Floating-Point Types¶
Floating-Point Type Maximum Value
float32 3.4028234 x 1038
float64 1.7976931348623157 x 10308

ITTIA DB IoT also includes a 32-bit currency data type that has a fixed precision of 2 decimal digits. When a currency value is accessed through the C or C++ API, the value is stored in a sint32_t variable that must be divided by 100 to obtain the correct value stored in the database.

Table 6.3: Fixed-Point Types¶
Integer Type Minimum Value Maximum Value
currency -21,474,836.48 21,474,836.47
